column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column7: In FY23, on manager (level 3), the female percentage was 25.1%. On Supervisor, Superintendent, Coordinator (Level 2) was 17%. On Operator, Technical Advisor was 16.9%.

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column7: The range ratio of the basic salary of women to the basic pay of men of Brujack, Cadia, Lihir, Red Chris, Telfer, Exploration, Havieron, Namosi, WGJV, and Corporate Offices span from 69 to 99 among the Board, the Executive - Level 5, General Manager - Level 4, Manager - Level 3, Supervisor, superintendent, coordinator - Level 2, and Operator, Technical advisor - Level 1.

column6: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column7: Three incidents of discrimination were reported for FY23. These related to allegations of discrimination and harassment in September 2022 at Brucejack. The site HR team investigated the incidents, and Company Standards took appropriate disciplinary action.

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column7: 0 operations identified as having significant risk for the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining. Newcrest has the Employee Organisations Standard (HR-ST-121), which details the rights of employees regarding freedom of association. Cadia has a Collective Bargaining Agreement in place - this was bargained directly with eligible employees and ratified in July 2021 and is in operation until July 2025. Red Chris has recently negotiated a collective bargaining agreement with the United Steel Workers Union with eligible employees. The deal is now in effect, with two matters currently pending arbitration. Telfer has a Collective Bargaining Agreement in place - this was bargained directly with eligible employees and ratified in November 2020 and is in operation until November 2024.

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column7: Newcrest complies with all minimum safety and age requirements for employees. It expects Suppliers to comply with all safety requirements, minimum age requirements and our human rights expectations. These requirements are managed through our purchase order terms, contract terms and conditions, and Supplier Performance Commitments. Young people may be engaged in approved apprentice programs. Newcrest mitigates risk through contract/purchase order terms, supplier sustainability questionnaires, high-risk category deep dives and World-Check supplier screening.

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column7: Newcrest mitigates risk through contract/purchase order terms, supplier sustainability questionnaires, high-risk category deep dives and World-Check supplier screening.

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
column7: For our Australian and Canadian sites, online training is part of the initial induction for new security employees and contractors, with refresher training managed through our Learning Management System. In-person training is conducted at our sites without access to online learning.

column6: Incidents of violations involving rights of indigenous peoples
column13: In FY23, we continued to strengthen Cultural Heritage management to seek to address potential risks proactively. It is demonstrated in developing the new standalone Cultural Heritage Standard and Functional Guidance Note, which includes consideration of Indigenous and First Nations heritage and historical and industrial heritage of non-Indigenous communities.
column20: Cultural Heritage Management, Functional Guidance Note, Indigenous and First Nations

column6: Incidents of violations involving rights of indigenous peoples
column13: Sites have surface disturbance procedures outlining specific cultural heritage requirements to be fulfilled before ground disturbance occurs. Ground disturbance requirements must be satisfied before any work commences. In areas where jobs are undertaken on previously disturbed ground, each site has a Chance Find Procedure to protect and manage any cultural heritage that may have yet to be identified previously through surveys and other assessments.
column20: Chance Find Procedure, Surface Disturbance, Disturbed Ground
